issue.title: Useless indexing
issue.body: coala filters the ignored files after indexing all the files, which can take a long time with globs such as **. Build tools like Tox create temporary folders with multitude of files, and coala on every run will index them first and then filter them out. In a small project the indexing and filtering can take about 75% of the execution time (80 seconds). This should be fixed by filtering during the process of indexing.

issue.title: Travis CI Sentinel build failing due to new version of pytest-xdist installed
issue.body:
Overview Description
Steps to Reproduce

Clone the coala repository
Install test-requirements.txt
Figure out which version of pytest-xdist is installed. It must be v1.28.0 but v1.15.0 should be installed acc. to requirements.
Run pytest on coala to get the error log

Actual Results
Travis CI Sentinel build error log
Reproducibility
100%
Additional Info
7 days back only pytest-xdist has released its new version v1.28.0
which is getting installed and has requirements of pytest>4.4.0

issue.title: coala_main.py and other files exceed line length according to PEP8 standard
issue.body:
coala_main.py, coalib/core/Core.py, setup.py, and some other files exceed the line length limit according to PEP8 standard.
Some of them can possibly be solved by adjusting the imports and docstrings.

issue.title: coala -A throws exception on EOF signal
issue.body:
Overview Description
Sending EOF signal to coala -A results in EOFError
Steps to Reproduce

run coala with -A or --single-action flag
press Ctrl-D(EOF signal)
EOFError is dumped to the console

Actual Results
EOFError is dumped on console with the following traceback
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/amol/anaconda3/envs/coala/bin/coala", line 11, in <module>
    load_entry_point('coala', 'console_scripts', 'coala')()
  File "/home/amol/GitHub/coala/coalib/coala.py", line 121, in main
    return mode_normal(console_printer, None, args, debug=debug)
  File "/home/amol/GitHub/coala/coalib/coala_modes.py", line 29, in mode_normal
    debug=debug)
  File "/home/amol/GitHub/coala/coalib/coala_main.py", line 116, in run_coala
    choice = input(line)
EOFError

Expected Results
A better message like, Found EOF. Exiting gracefully. should be shown and the process must exit with status code 0
Reproducibility
100%
Additional Information:
difficulty/low
coala/main

issue.title: Setting.py: Change property name
issue.body:
The line_number property for Setting class should be changed to start_line_number as it is the starting line number of a setting.
difficulty/newcomer

issue.title: Waffle.io not working
issue.body:
The Readme.md file the waffle.io integeration is not working

As it shows that there is not any pr or issues closed recently.

but on browsing through issues and pull requests, we can see that there are some recently closed issues.
I think that there might be some problem with waffle.io . @li-boxuan @jayvdb please provide feedback. I would love to contribute on this issue.

issue.title: Add linter bear type 'json'
issue.body:
Many linters now emit json, and we have regular bugs when a linter is emitting json but also emits an error message on stdout.
The loading of the json can be done in coala with appropriate error checking and logging of any problems.
Also if the json is empty, the bear .run doesnt need to be invoked.

issue.title: Modify `Linter` module for aspects
issue.body: Linter module needs to be modified so that the Result object makes use of aspects. It can be made similar to the implementation in the Result module plus more features can be added to make it even more usable.

issue.title: Multiple ignore in single settings section
issue.body:
[section]
ignore = aaa
ignore = bbb

Expected behavior:
It should throw an error
Current behavior:
Both aaa & bbb gets ignored.
The same happens when .coafile contains:
[section]
ignore = aaa
ignore += bbb
ignore = ccc

i.e, all aaa, bbb and ccc gets ignored.

issue.title: Exception while using variable as value for message_arguments dictionary items
issue.body:
Overview Description : When passing a variable name as a dictionary item value in message_arguments for new_result() API, it  raises an exception TypeError: unorderable types: dict() < dict().
class Rule8:
    CLASS_NAME_LOWER_CASE = {
        'message': "Class-name starts with an lower case '{name}'",
        'additional_info': "Class-name should NOT start with lower case",
        'severity': SEV.MAJOR,
        'confidence': 100
    }
for cname in cname_list: 
    yield self.new_result(**Rule8.CLASS_NAME_LOWER_CASE,
                                  message_arguments= {'name': cname},
                                  file=filename)

cname is of type <class 'str'>
Steps to Reproduce

Reading a text file with lines of single word and creating a list ( cname_list)
Iterating through each items in cname_list and calling yield new_result with message_argument = {'name': cname}
Running coala, it raises an exception.

Actual Results
raises an exception TypeError: unorderable types: dict() < dict().
Logs are at https://pastebin.com/WQJSNr83
Expected Results
coala should show the result.
Reproducibility
Always
Additional Information:
coala==0.11.0
coala-bears==0.11.1
coala-utils==0.6.7
appdirs==1.4.3
certifi==2018.1.18
chardet==3.0.4
clang==5.0
coala==0.11.0
coala-utils==0.6.7
colorama==0.3.9
colorlog==2.10.0
dependency-management==0.4.0
idna==2.6
Pygments==2.2.0
PyPrint==0.2.6
requests==2.18.4
sarge==0.1.4
termcolor==1.1.0
unidiff==0.5.5
urllib3==1.22

issue.title: Make `--files` optional (useful when only GitCommitBear is used)
issue.body:
If I only want to run GitCommitBear, why bother adding files which GitCommitBear doesn't use at all?
Currently, running coala --bears GitCommitBear returns
[WARNING][15:34:52] coala will not run any analysis. Did you forget to give the `--files` argument?

issue.title: Add Jekyll Liquid language
issue.body:
We use Liquid language in Jekyll sites.
We should have a language definition for it.

issue.title: Invalid link to GitHub on coala API Documentation
issue.body:
coala uses Read the Docs to generate API webpages. However, there is a floating window at the bottom right corner which displays a link to corresponding GitHub page.
For example, on the page coalib package, you can click on the small floating window at the bottom right corner and it would display a window as follows:

The view link points to https://github.com/coala/coala/blob/master/docs/coalib.rst, which doesn't exist.

issue.title: Remove implementation of SpaceConsistencyTestBear
issue.body:
SpaceConsistencyTestBear contains an old algorithm of the SpaceConsistencyBear.
And there are five tests which depend on the output of its algorithm.
When the run method is replaced with pass, these tests fail:
FAIL tests/coalaCITest.py::coalaCITest::test_limit_files_affirmative
FAIL tests/coalaCITest.py::coalaCITest::test_show_patch
FAIL tests/coalaCITest.py::coalaCITest::test_show_patch_debug
FAIL tests/coalaTest.py::coalaTest::test_run_coala_no_autoapply
FAIL tests/coalaTest.py::coalaTest::test_run_coala_no_autoapply_debug

But more importantly, some unexpected parts of the codebase suddenly have no coverage.
coalib/coala_main.py                                                  104      1     48      1    99%   207, 206->207
coalib/output/ConsoleInteraction.py                                   337      1    156      1    99%   296, 287->296
coalib/results/result_actions/ShowPatchAction.py                       72      2     28      1    97%   104-107, 103->104

That means those lines of code are being indirectly tested by the inner workings of the bear.
These lines of code all need specific tests which are not based on large, old and convoluted algorithm of a bear.
They should have tiny neat little bears which are very simple and do only enough to activate those lines of code, and do it directly.

issue.title: Unable to collect Bear from X - coala-bear package names clash with bear's dependency module name
issue.body:
Related to #2053
https://travis-ci.org/coala/coala-bears/jobs/276993965#L3832
The command "bash .ci/tests.sh" exited with 0.
1.95s$ .ci/generate_bear_requirements.py
WARNING:root:Unable to collect bears from /home/travis/build/coala/coala-bears/bears/general/LinkBackupBear.py. Probably the file is malformed or the module code raises an exception.
INFO:root:Exception was:
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/travis/virtualenv/python3.5.3/lib/python3.5/site-packages/coalib/collecting/Collectors.py", line 134, in icollect_bears
    for bear in _import_bears(matching_file, kinds):
  File "/home/travis/virtualenv/python3.5.3/lib/python3.5/site-packages/coalib/collecting/Collectors.py", line 26, in _import_bears
    types=list):
  File "/home/travis/virtualenv/python3.5.3/lib/python3.5/site-packages/coalib/collecting/Importers.py", line 160, in iimport_objects
    attributes, local)
  File "/home/travis/virtualenv/python3.5.3/lib/python3.5/site-packages/coala_utils/decorators.py", line 26, in yield_once_generator
    for item in iterator(*args, **kwargs):
  File "/home/travis/virtualenv/python3.5.3/lib/python3.5/site-packages/coalib/collecting/Importers.py", line 119, in _iimport_objects
    module = _import_module(file_path)
  File "/home/travis/virtualenv/python3.5.3/lib/python3.5/site-packages/coalib/collecting/Importers.py", line 31, in _import_module
    return __import__(module_name)
  File "/home/travis/build/coala/coala-bears/bears/general/LinkBackupBear.py", line 9, in <module>
    import tubeup.__main__
  File "/home/travis/virtualenv/python3.5.3/lib/python3.5/site-packages/tubeup/__main__.py", line 30, in <module>
    import internetarchive.cli
  File "/home/travis/virtualenv/python3.5.3/lib/python3.5/site-packages/internetarchive/cli/__init__.py", line 27, in <module>
    from internetarchive.cli import ia, ia_configure, ia_delete, ia_download, ia_list, \
  File "/home/travis/virtualenv/python3.5.3/lib/python3.5/site-packages/internetarchive/cli/ia_metadata.py", line 50, in <module>
    from backports import csv
  File "/home/travis/virtualenv/python3.5.3/lib/python3.5/site-packages/backports/csv.py", line 22, in <module>
    from csv import (
ImportError: cannot import name 'QUOTE_MINIMAL'
DEBUG:pip.vcs:Registered VCS backend: git
DEBUG:pip.vcs:Registered VCS backend: hg
DEBUG:pip.vcs:Registered VCS backend: svn
DEBUG:pip.vcs:Registered VCS backend: bzr

This is what sys.path contains when .ci/generate_bear_requirements.py runs:
['./bears/general', './bears/elm', './bears/documentation', './bears/dart', './bears/csv', './bears/css', './bears/configfiles', './bears/coffee_script', './bears/cmake', './bears/c_languages/codeclone_detection', './bears/c_languages', './bears/apertium', './bears', '/home/rafid/GitHub/coala-bears', '/home/rafid/.venvs/coala-bears-py3/lib64/python36.zip', '/home/rafid/.venvs/coala-bears-py3/lib64/python3.6', '/home/rafid/.venvs/coala-bears-py3/lib64/python3.6/lib-dynload', '/usr/lib64/python3.6', '/usr/lib/python3.6', '/home/rafid/.venvs/coala-bears-py3/lib/python3.6/site-packages', '/home/rafid/GitHub/coala-bears']
This happens because sys.path contains path to coala-bears packages, therefore the name of bear's dependency clashes with package names in bears directory, such as ./bears/csv.
When Collectors imports another bears, coalib/collecting/Importers.py:_import_module() appends bear's module path to sys.path, so when I run Travis-CI test for LinkBackupBear (coala/coala-bears#1899) that one of the dependencies depends on backports.csv. When backports.csv imports the csv module, it imports the wrong csv module, it imports ./bears/csv instead of the csv that backports.csv expects.

issue.title: coala --json returns `"aspect": "NoneType"` instead of null
issue.body:
json has a null type, just run coala on anything that has results and you'll get "aspect": "NoneType" instead of "aspect": null
CC @coala/aspects-developers

issue.title: Linter.py: Make it possible to override `executable` for all linter bears
issue.body:
Say, we have a linter bear called FooLinterBear:
@linter(executable='foo', output=[...])
class FooLinterBear:
   [...]
If a user is in an environment, where they can't make the wrapped tool available as foo in the $PATH or want to use a different version than is regularly installed, they currently have no way to use the bear, since the executable is hard-coded. I discovered this, when I wanted to use PyflakesBear for a Python 2 project: Pyflakes has the same output in both versions, so the linter would work fine, if I could override the executable with the Python 2 version.
I'm imagining something like this:
[python]
bears=Pyflakesbear
override_executable=/path/to/python2/pyflakes
Obviously, this would have to be used with great care and should probably always emit a warning, since it's easy to destroy the functionality of the bear.
I'm not sure if that's something we want to add, so please add your opinions :)

the program will exit 1 if user pressing Ctrl + D.

issue.title: coala_modes.py: Show language capabilities in json
issue.body:
coala provides a way to users to get to know about
capabilities of a language i.e. What can it detect
and fix. But it is output as a normal std output.
This commit adds a way to show language capabilities
in JSON format i.e. in coala-json.
Closes #2467
Checklist

 I read the commit guidelines and I've followed
them.
 I ran coala over my code locally.

comments.bodyText: Ctrl-Z-Enter would look like we need to press all the 3 keys simultaneously. But iirc, The proper way to send an EOF signal in Windows is to press Ctrl-Z followed by Enter. So something like, Ctrl-Z followed by Enter would seem more appropriate.
comments.diffHunk:
@@ -31,7 +31,7 @@ def do_nothing(*args):
 
 
 STR_ENTER_LETTER = 'Enter letter (Ctrl-{} to exit): '.format(
-    'Z' if platform.system() == 'Windows' else 'D')
+    'Z-Enter' if platform.system() == 'Windows' else 'D')

Also you have not fixed gitmate problem pls look at it once again

@AkshJain99 Yeah sorry, forgot a small one :p
@tanmaysachan  Travis is failing, you need to add tests.
@akshatkarani Alright I will alter the patch accordingly.
@akshatkarani I guess this is more in line to what the issue wanted. Yet to add tests.
Looks good, now make travis green.

@akshatkarani I could add this by perhaps creating a specific keyword (say "ABORT" in all caps) to abort the action. But it would become incredibly specific (one specific keyword for one parameter for one action as well as a different output question which specifies this keyword). Should I still go ahead with it?
Is there any alternate way to achieve this? Because I dont see any way other than a keyword.
2 ways I could think of:

My first commit, just add the action to failed_actions and let the user chose the action again.
Make this keyword applicable to all actions, such that it aborts any action currently running, when supplied with the "ABORT" parameter, and not necessarily IgnoreResultAction.
@tanmaysachan  Well you could ask user whether he wants to go back.
@akshatkarani where exactly? Do you want me to add another option when the user is being asked for params? As in, "enter 'O' to abort the action", alongside the enter the language message?
After user enters the language and it asks for language again, give two options either enter the language again or go back. This would be good IMO.
@akshatkarani yeah that's what i meant about the code becoming too specific. But if you're okay with that then cool, ill implement it.

Its better to someone else's opinion on this.

@jayvdb any suggestions?

can you look for a way to have load_configuration return the old tuple return type, and create a new function to return the new improved return type.
Otherwise load_configuration is broken in all existing uses of it, and most coala tools use it, and expect a tuple returned.

issue.title: coala_modes.py: Add a new mode to emit diff
issue.body:
This commit adds a new mode to coala. This mode will emit the patches obtained by the bears in unified diff format. To use this mode command is coala --diff. If the user wants to specify output file, --output can be used.
Closes #5379
